New Records: New Zealand's unbeaten 273-run third-wicket stand between Rachin Ravindra (123*) and Devon Conway (152*)
Rachin Ravindra and Devon Conway's partnership broke the previous record of 168 runs set in 1996
All 11 New Zealand batters scored in double figures
Key Match Events: New Zealand hit 13 fours and two sixes in the first Powerplay
Jos Buttler dismissal in the 27th over
Ravindra and Conway reaching their respective centuries
England's dismissal of key players like Joe Root and Liam Livingstone
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand's stand-in captain Tom Latham called it right at the toss
Absence of Kane Williamson and Tim Southee for New Zealand
Ben Stokes' absence from England's opening match
England's title defense started with Jonny Bairstow's six on the first ball
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand's victory was seen as a strong start to the tournament
Simon Doull and Tanvi Shah's analysis highlighted the Black Caps' dominance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a rematch of the 2019 World Cup final
All 11 batters from one side scoring in double figures is a rare occurrence
The high-scoring nature of the match
Others: Weather and pitch conditions were not a major factor
